intro: Heliconia griggsiana, commonly known as the orange heliconia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored inflorescences. The plant produces large, fleshy bracts that enclose numerous small, clustered flowers, which are often orange or red in color. Heliconia griggsiana is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its structure and appearance make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
